Hi,

first you should know, that you have to dig in more advanced
junit top=
ics to cope with your task.

For myself I read http://junit.sourceforge.net=
/ and the
JUnit-Cookbook as beginner. It's a simple starting point to
get i=
nto unittesting. Especially in your case I would suggest
you to get more ac=
quainted with junit.

A more advanced book that gives a very deep understan=
ding
of unit tests I found in "xUnit Test Patterns"
(Gerard Meszaros). That=
 should give you the real taste of
junit without suffering the common junit=
 beginner pitfalls.

In the second step you should be able to decide if you=

use pure junit to take your task or to use a framework
additional, that ma=
y simplify some testing tasks in your
environment, for example to test http=
-communication.

best regards
Martin
